summary: Audit existing editor stack and integration surface
problem_statement: Editor-level auto-correction must integrate safely within the existing editor, Vue lifecycle, and persistence flows without disrupting cursor position, undo history, or long-form performance. Without a precise audit of the current stack, configuration, and data flow, subsequent implementation risks introducing subtle trust-breaking bugs or architectural misalignment.
in_scope: Identify current editor technology and versions
Document editor extensions, plugins, and schema
Map text input, key handling, and paste interception points
Trace autosave and persistence flows end-to-end
Assess performance characteristics for long-form documents
out_of_scope: Refactoring unrelated frontend or backend code
requirements: Editor stack and versions are identified and recorded
All active editor extensions and plugins are enumerated
Safe interception points for future auto-correction are identified
acceptance_criteria: An audit document exists describing the current editor stack and constraints
Known risks and unknowns are explicitly listed
No production code behavior has changed
dependencies: Ability to run the editor locally with representative long-form content
risks: Hidden editor plugins mutating content unexpectedly
Performance bottlenecks exposed by long documents
implementation_notes: This is an investigative task only. Bias toward documentation over refactoring. Prefer concrete observations and diagrams over speculative fixes.
